body:
For now vagrant requires at least one provider.

You could try to install simplest provider, for example I just tried with vagrant-managed-servers plugin, example below:

```bash
root@ubuntu1604:~# wget https://releases.hashicorp.com/vagrant/2.1.5/vagrant_2.1.5_x86_64.deb
--2018-09-23 09:28:13--  https://releases.hashicorp.com/vagrant/2.1.5/vagrant_2.1.5_x86_64.deb
Resolving releases.hashicorp.com (releases.hashicorp.com)... 151.101.193.183, 151.101.129.183, 151.101.65.183, ...
Connecting to releases.hashicorp.com (releases.hashicorp.com)|151.101.193.183|:443... connected.
HTTP request sent, awaiting response... 200 OK
Length: 40034782 (38M) [application/x-debian-package]
Saving to: 'vagrant_2.1.5_x86_64.deb'

vagrant_2.1.5_x86_64.deb                                    100%[========================================================================================================================================>]  38.18M  8.45MB/s    in 4.8s    

2018-09-23 09:28:18 (7.97 MB/s) - 'vagrant_2.1.5_x86_64.deb' saved [40034782/40034782]

root@ubuntu1604:~# dpkg -i vagrant_2.1.5_x86_64.deb 
Selecting previously unselected package vagrant.
(Reading database ... 109385 files and directories currently installed.)
Preparing to unpack vagrant_2.1.5_x86_64.deb ...
Unpacking vagrant (1:2.1.5) ...
Setting up vagrant (1:2.1.5) ...
root@ubuntu1604:~# vagrant plugin install vagrant-managed-servers
Installing the 'vagrant-managed-servers' plugin. This can take a few minutes...
Fetching: vagrant-managed-servers-0.8.0.gem (100%)
Installed the plugin 'vagrant-managed-servers (0.8.0)'!
root@ubuntu1604:~/derp# vagrant plugin list
vagrant-managed-servers (0.8.0, global)
root@ubuntu1604:~# vagrant box add dummy https://github.com/tknerr/vagrant-managed-servers/raw/master/dummy.box --provider=managed
==> box: Box file was not detected as metadata. Adding it directly...
==> box: Adding box 'dummy' (v0) for provider: managed
    box: Downloading: https://github.com/tknerr/vagrant-managed-servers/raw/master/dummy.box
    box: Download redirected to host: raw.githubusercontent.com
==> box: Successfully added box 'dummy' (v0) for 'managed'!
root@ubuntu1604:~# mkdir derp 
root@ubuntu1604:~# cd derp
root@ubuntu1604:~/derp# cat > Vagrantfile <<EOF
Vagrant.configure("2") do |config|
  config.vm.box = "dummy"

  config.vm.provider :managed do |managed, override|
    managed.server = "127.0.0.1"
    override.ssh.username = "nobody"
    override.ssh.private_key_path = "~/.vagrant.d/insecure_private_key"
  end
end

EOF
```

@briancain Seems that its not wokring corectly..

```
$ /opt/vagrant/vagrant version
Installed Version: 2.2.1
Latest Version: 2.2.1
 
You're running an up-to-date version of Vagrant!
$ /opt/vagrant/vagrant validate -p
No usable default provider could be found for your system.

Vagrant relies on interactions with 3rd party systems, known as
"providers", to provide Vagrant with resources to run development
environments. Examples are VirtualBox, VMware, Hyper-V.

The easiest solution to this message is to install VirtualBox, which
is available for free on all major platforms.

If you believe you already have a provider available, make sure it
is properly installed and configured. You can see more details about
why a particular provider isn't working by forcing usage with
`vagrant up --provider=PROVIDER`, which should give you a more specific
error message for that particular provider.
ERROR: Job failed: exit code 1
```
@lukasmrtvy - Ahh, you're right. Apologies, I missed this. Should be an easy fix that I'll try to get in today, and will be out in a patch release hopefully soon.

@lukasmrtvy - I missed the patch release this week, but I just made a PR here https://github.com/hashicorp/vagrant/pull/10467 that addresses this. With that change Vagrant should be able to validate Vagrantfiles without an installed or usable provider.
@lukasmrtvy that should go to another issue ;)
